intro: Aragallus acutirostris, commonly known as the narrow-beaked aragallus, is a flowering plant native to the Andes mountains of South America. It belongs to the family Polygonaceae, which includes plants known for their distinctive leaf shapes and sometimes edible roots. The plant is characterized by its slender stems and small, clustered flowers that bloom in shades of pink or white. It thrives in high-altitude environments, often growing in rocky or alpine conditions. Due to its limited distribution and specific habitat requirements, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
